text: Hi Halima! Thank you for telling me about how your interview went... I'm really happy for you! It sounds largely positive, and even though you had incomplete pieces, you still got an offer! So, *CONGRATULATIONS*!!!!
How did you feel during the interview? Were there any questions you struggled with? (it doesn't sound like it tbh... sounds like you handled it really well!)
Where else have you applied? And do you have interviews already scheduled? (if so, when?)

Regarding your drawings / portfolio and what other students are doing, I think you're already in a good position - so don't worry too much :slightly_smiling_face: Receiving an offer now puts you in a great position... and demonstrates that it's not necessarily about your past projects / work, but about you and your approach, and your reason for wanting to study architecture. This has clearly already shone through :+1:
Have a look through the document and let me know if you have any questions... happy to help!

Thank you! :slightly_smiling_face: I think I felt more confident in this interview because I discussed my past experience with you and felt a lot more reassured that I'll only get better at interviews. Also, my last interview had 3 interviewers which made me feel really anxious because I felt like I had to impress all three but this interview was only one which was good.

I forgot to mention, he asked what my hobbies outside of school were and it took me a few minutes to construct an answer. I told him I liked reading, recently discovered there's something called political fiction (after attending a UCL lecture by a famous author Kamila Shamsie) and that interested me and I will be looking forward to exploring books in that category. I told him about my interest in art, again, and my love for exploring places and taking pictures to capture the moment. I think my answer still seemed academic based, but he did comment on how he think I use my time productively - right after, so I'm not sure what other universities are expecting

I've applied to UCL, Westminster, Kingston, Greenwich and London South Bank. UCL has asked me to send them 5 drawing tasks by post by the 28th of January and it's the 21st today and I only found that email in my inbox today! It was sent to me on the 14th and I don't think I will meet the standards of other students and I'll get a lot worked up if I try completing them this week, only to not hear back from the university (we don't get our drawings back either). I don't want to attend UCL anymore, in the long term I don't think I can handle the pressure of being at a university like that with students more able than me.
So technically I'm looking to get into Westminster, I know a few older students that have gone to study there too. My interview is on the 13th.
I haven't heard back from Kingston and London South Bank, yet
